verses.verse: And if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H2398>sin<s%>, and <S%H8085>hear<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of <S%H423>swearing<s%>, and is a <S%H5707>witness<s%>, <S%H176>whether<s%> he has <S%H7200>seen<s%> or <S%H3045>known<s%> of <S%H5046>it<s%>; if he do not utter <S%H5375>it<s%>, then he shall carry his <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

Or if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H5060>touch<s%> any <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H1697>thing<s%>, whether it be a <S%H5038>carcass<s%> of an <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H2416>animal<s%>, or a <S%H5038>carcass<s%> of <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H929>cattle<s%>, or the <S%H5038>carcass<s%> of <S%H2931>unclean<s%> creeping <S%H8318>things<s%>, and if it be <S%H5956>hidden<s%> from <S%H2931>him<s%>; he also shall be unclean, and <S%H816>guilty<s%>.

Or if he <S%H5060>touch<s%> the <S%H2932>uncleanness<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%>, whatever <S%H2932>uncleanness<s%> it be that a man shall be <S%H2930>defiled<s%> <S%H5956>with<s%>, and it be hid from <S%H3045>him<s%>; when he knows of <S%H816>it<s%>, then he shall be guilty.

Or if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H7650>swear<s%>, <S%H981>pronouncing<s%> with his <S%H8193>lips<s%> to do <S%H7489>evil<s%>, or to do <S%H3190>good<s%>, whatever it be that a <S%H120>man<s%> shall <S%H981>pronounce<s%> with an <S%H7621>oath<s%>, and it be <S%H5956>hid<s%> from <S%H3045>him<s%>; when he knows of <S%H816>it<s%>, then he shall be guilty in one of <S%H259>these<s%>.
And it shall <S%H816>be<s%>, when he shall be guilty in <S%H259>one<s%> of these <S%H3034>things<s%>, that he shall confess that he has sinned in that <S%H2398>thing<s%>:

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> his trespass <S%H817>offering<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> for his <S%H2403>sin<s%> which he has <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, a <S%H5347>female<s%> from the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, a <S%H3776>lamb<s%> or a <S%H8166>kid<s%> of the <S%H5795>goats<s%>, for a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>; and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him concerning his <S%H2403>sin<s%>.

And if <S%H3027>he<s%> be not <S%H1767>able<s%> to <S%H5060>bring<s%> a <S%H7716>lamb<s%>, then he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> <S%H854>for<s%> his <S%H817>trespass<s%>, which he has <S%H2398>committed<s%>, <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H8449>turtledoves<s%>, or <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H1121>young<s%> <S%H3123>pigeons<s%>, unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>; <S%H259>one<s%> for a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>, and the <S%H259>other<s%> for a burnt <S%H5930>offering<s%>.

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> them unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, who shall <S%H7126>offer<s%> that which is for the sin <S%H2403>offering<s%> <S%H7223>first<s%>, and wring <S%H4454>off<s%> his <S%H7218>head<s%> <S%H4136>from<s%> his <S%H6203>neck<s%>, but shall not divide it <S%H914>asunder<s%>:

And he shall <S%H5137>sprinkle<s%> of the <S%H1818>blood<s%> of the sin <S%H2403>offering<s%> upon the <S%H7023>side<s%> of the <S%H4196>altar<s%>; and the <S%H7604>rest<s%> of the <S%H1818>blood<s%> shall be wrung <S%H4680>out<s%> at the <S%H3247>bottom<s%> of the <S%H4196>altar<s%>: it is a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>.

And he shall <S%H6213>offer<s%> the <S%H8145>second<s%> for a burnt <S%H5930>offering<s%>, according to the <S%H4941>manner<s%>: and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him for his <S%H2403>sin<s%> which he has <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545>him<s%>.

But if <S%H3027>he<s%> be not able to <S%H5381>bring<s%> <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H8449>turtledoves<s%>, or <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H1121>young<s%> <S%H3123>pigeons<s%>, then he that <S%H2398>sinned<s%> shall <S%H935>bring<s%> for his <S%H7133>offering<s%> the <S%H6224>tenth<s%> part of an <S%H374>ephah<s%> of fine <S%H5560>flour<s%> for a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>; he shall <S%H7760>put<s%> no <S%H8081>oil<s%> upon <S%H5414>it<s%>, neither shall he put any <S%H3828>frankincense<s%> on it for it is a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>.

Then shall he <S%H935>bring<s%> it to the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall <S%H7061>take<s%> his <S%H4393>handful<s%> of <S%H234>it<s%>, even a memorial <S%H6999>there<s%>, and burn it on the <S%H4196>altar<s%>, according to the offerings made by <S%H801>fire<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>: it is a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>.

And the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him as touching his <S%H2403>sin<s%> that he has <S%H2398>sinned<s%> in <S%H259>one<s%> of <S%H5545>these<s%>, and it shall be forgiven <S%H3548>him<s%>: and the remnant shall be the priest's, as a food <S%H4503>offering<s%>.

If a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H4603>commit<s%> a <S%H4604>trespass<s%>, and <S%H2398>sin<s%> through <S%H7684>ignorance<s%>, in the holy <S%H6944>things<s%> of the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>; then he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> for his <S%H817>trespass<s%> unto the <S%H3068>Lord<s%> a <S%H352>ram<s%> outside <S%H8549>blemish<s%> out of the <S%H6629>flocks<s%>, with your <S%H6187>estimation<s%> by <S%H8255>shekels<s%> of <S%H3701>silver<s%>, after the <S%H8255>shekel<s%> of the <S%H6944>sanctuary<s%>, for a trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>:

And he shall make <S%H7999>amends<s%> for the <S%H2398>harm<s%> that he has done in the holy <S%H6944>thing<s%>, and shall <S%H3254>add<s%> the fifth <S%H2549>part<s%> <S%H5414>thereto<s%>, and give it unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>: and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him with the <S%H352>ram<s%> of the trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>, and it shall be forgiven <S%H5545>him<s%>.

And if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H2398>sin<s%>, and <S%H6213>commit<s%> <S%H259>any<s%> of these things which are forbidden to be <S%H6213>done<s%> by the <S%H4687>commandments<s%> of the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>; though he <S%H3045>knew<s%> it <S%H816>not<s%>, yet is he guilty, and shall <S%H5375>carry<s%> his <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> a <S%H352>ram<s%> outside <S%H8549>blemish<s%> out of the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, with your <S%H6187>estimation<s%>, for a trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>, unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>: and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him concerning his <S%H7684>ignorance<s%> where he <S%H7683>erred<s%> and <S%H3045>knew<s%> it <S%H5545>not<s%>, and it shall be forgiven him.
It is a trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>: he has <S%H816>certainly<s%> <S%H816>trespassed<s%> against the <S%H3068>Lord<s%>.
